ref: 8149 piccayati ʻ presses flat ʼ Dhātup., pp. piccita -- Suśr. [Cf. picchayati ʻ id. ʼ Dhātup., picchana -- n. ʻ pressing ʼ Car. <-> Connexion with picati ʻ contracts ʼ, utpicati ʻ stretches out ʼ, nipicati, nipikna -- ʻ bends ʼ (see EWA ii 269) is doubtful]
P. pīcṇā ʻ to be hard and tight ʼ;
Ku. picīṇo ʻ to be crushed, be powdered ʼ;
H. piccī ʻ crushed, smashed, jammed ʼ;
Or. pici -- kiḷā ʻ bamboo pins in plough -- hole to tighten the beam ʼ; <-> ext. with -- kk -- :
P. picakṇā ʻ to be squeezed ʼ (caus. pickāuṇā);
Or. picikibā ʻ to spurt, (of water) to spurt out ʼ, (Sambhalpur) pickāibā ʻ to press out (pus from a wound, stone from a mango) ʼ;
H. picaknā ʻ to be pressed ʼ (caus. pickānā).
